text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
(1) IRM 4.71.6 contains the procedures for processing referrals related to employee plan examinations.
This supersedes IRM 4.71.6 dated November 20, 2018.
Tax Exempt and Government Entities Employee Plans
Table of Contents
Referrals
) Purpose: IRM

, Employee Plans Examination of Returns, Employee Plans Referrals, provides the basic examination procedures that will enable Employee Plans (EP) agents and their managers to: a. Make referrals on issues found during an examination. b. Process examination referrals received from other sources. (
) Audience: This IRM provides procedures for agents, managers, and staff in EP Examinations. (
) Program Owner: Director, EP Examinations. (
) Program Authority: EP Examinations derives its authority to conduct nations, resolve issues and determine tax liability from Title
, Internal Revenue Code, Subtitle F – Procedure and Administration, which includes is not limited to: a. IRC section
- Examination of books and witnesses, which falls under Chapter
- Discovery of Liability and Enforcement of Title. Note: IRC

provides agents with the authority to: * Audit any books, papers, records or other data necessary to complete an audit. * Take testimony under oath to secure additional information needed.*Issuesummons for information necessary to complete an audit. * Ask about any offense connected to the administering or of the Internal Revenue laws. b. IRC section
- Assessment authority, which falls under Chapter
Assessment. Note: EP Examinations’ authority to resolve issues is derived from its authority make determinations of tax liability under IRC

, Prior Year, Subsequent Year and Related and the processing of Form

Note: All referrals received by TE/GE from the public or other governmental will be acknowledged through issuance of Letter
, Acknowledging Receipt of Information from Third Party about Tax Exempt or Government Entities . Classiﬁcation normally issues Letter
If the letter was not sent by siﬁcation, the agent will prepare and mail the letter. For instructions on how prepare the letter see the IRM

, Classiﬁcation and Case Assignment (C&CA) Procedures. Note: Before the reorganization of TE/GE, each functional unit (other than the Referrals group) established referrals in RCCMS as referral activities and evaluated them to determine if they warranted compliance action. converted those that warranted compliance action to compliance activities, completed case building and assigned the compliance activities to ﬁeld groups. The new procedures are addressed in the new IRM
, cation and Case Assignment (C&CA) Procedures. (
) Unless stated otherwise in this IRM, the group manager or designee will send approved referrals to Classiﬁcation (TE/GE Referrals Group) via email. See IRM
, Contact Information for Business Units and Sub-functions, for contact information. (
) If an EP agent or manager sends a direct referral to another EFU, the agent manager must also send a full copy of the referral to Classiﬁcation (TE/GE Referrals Group).
Example: An EP agent makes a referral directly to the SB/SE agent working the related income tax exam. The EP agent must also send a copy of the referral to Classiﬁcation (TE/GE Referrals Group).
EP receives referrals from EFUs and TE/GE functional divisions on Form 4632 or Form 5666 and from DOL on Form 6212-A:

Referral from Prepared on EFU Form 4632 (with Form 4632-A) or Form 5346 EO Form 5666 GE (other than those in para 10) Form 5666 FSLG for 403(b) plans or 457 ar- Form 4632 (with Form 4632-C) rangements EBSA Form 6212-A
EP makes referrals to IRS groups and government agencies on these forms.

The agent responsible for the case will contact the EFU agent, EP Determina- tions specialist, EO agent, GE agent, FSLG agent, ITG agent or EBSA investigator within 30 workdays of the group’s receipt of Form 4632 (with checksheet 4632-A, 4632-B, or 4632-C, as applicable), Form 5346, Form or Form 6212-A if the related case is being held open in the EFU or in EBSA.
Note: The EP agent should periodically update the related examiner or investigator on the examination’s status and results.
If a related examination is open in EO, GE, FSLG, EBSA, or an EFU, or deter- mination is open in EP Determinations, make every attempt to resolve every issue within
days of your group’s referral receipt. If the case is not closed Internal Revenue Manual Cat. No.
W
within
days, the EP group manager should contact the referring group manager to update them on the status of the examination. (
) Agent: Once you resolve the referral: a. Prepare a brief examination report on EP’s ﬁndings on the referred Use Form
-A, Explanation of Items, or a memo. b. Send the examination report and a copy of the referral (Form
or Form

-A) directly to the agent/investigator if they have a related amination open and are anticipating an update. Send a copy of the examination report and the referral to Classiﬁcation. c. Notify the EP Determinations specialist of the issue(s)’ resolution, if have a related open determination case and are expecting an update d. Document Form
e. Save a copy of the examination report and referral package in the RCCMS Office Documents folder using the RCCMS Naming (

) If the referring entity doesn’t prepare a referral form, the receiving group should prepare the applicable referral form and send it to Classiﬁcation. Example: An EP group receives a referral from a taxpayer. The agent or group should prepare Form
and send it to Classiﬁcation. (
) If your group decides to examine a return based on a referral received from an entity or individual, note the decision to examine on the referral when you send to Classiﬁcation. (
) Don’t begin any compliance activity for a referral unless you receive it from Classiﬁcation or Classiﬁcation approves the decision to examine. (

If the referring entity doesn’t prepare a referral form, the receiving group should prepare the applicable referral form and send it to Classiﬁcation.
An EP group receives a referral from a taxpayer. The agent or should prepare Form 5666 and send it to Classiﬁcation.

c. Send a copy of the referral to the TEGE Fraud Specialist. Note: The TEGE Fraud Specialist contact information is found on the TEGE Page at the Fraud Contacts link. (

) CP&C maintains the Compliance Issue Submission Portal for use when you discover a potential emerging issue. a. The Portal should be used to submit TE/GE compliance issues that may have wide-spread effect. b. The Portal helps enable TE/GE to leverage examination experiences to pursue non-compliance actions with a broader base of taxpayers. c. CP&C will review all submitted issues to determine the level of non- compliance and determine if a Compliance Strategy is warranted. (

) Notify the TEGE Fraud Specialist anytime you: a. Have an issue involving a promoter or an issue that may be an issue and you need feedback concerning the issue. b. Make a promoter referral or an emerging issue referral.
CP&C maintains the Compliance Issue Submission Portal for use when you discover a potential emerging issue.

DOL doesn’t have jurisdiction of plans that only provide beneﬁts to owners and their spouses. However, if you determine that a plan covering only one participant (or participant and spouse) should cover additional people, make a referral to DOL.
For full scope or focused EP examinations which include trust assets as an identiﬁed issue, complete the Form 6212-B based on your:
Review of ﬁnancial information on: the Forms 5500 or 5500-SF, related schedules, RICS return attachments and taxpayer provided information.
Employee Plans Examination of b. Identiﬁcation of large, unusual and questionable items. c. Examination of a plan’s books and records. (

-B based on your: a. Pre-audit review of the ﬁnancial information on: the Forms

or SF, related schedules and RICS return attachments. b. Identiﬁcation of large, unusual and questionable items. Note: Your limited ﬁnancial review may not offer sufficient evidence to ask more questions to include trust assets as an additional focused examination If so, “NA” is an appropriate response on Form
-B. However, answer “Yes” or “No” if there is evidence that allows you to determine if either applies. (

Hold any examination for which Form 6212-B is referred open until you receive a response or 30 days from the date sent to Classiﬁcation, if earlier.
Exception: IRS works the case when:

• Collection of a tax is in jeopardy. • The statute of limitations expires soon. • Plan assets or the plan participants’ interests must be protected. b. If IRS must work a case, the IRS will immediately notify DOL of the action by calling them and conﬁrming in writing within ﬁve workdays. (

Beneﬁt (
) Most deﬁned beneﬁt pension plans are covered by PBGC insurance. Corporation section
(b) lists plans that aren’t covered. Deﬁned beneﬁt plans not covered include: a. Plans offered by professional service employers (i.e., doctors and lawyers) that have never had more than
active participants. b. Plans outside the United States for nonresident aliens. c. Plans established exclusively for one or more substantial owners. d. Church plans, as deﬁned by IRC
(e), unless the plan has made election under IRC
(d) to be covered and has notiﬁed PBGC that wishes to be covered. e. Plans sponsored by federal, state and local governments. (
) When you determine a referral to the PBGC is warranted per Form

a. Create Referral Link– use to request a specialist’s services and one will be assigned to your case b. Example: Find links to the employment tax home page or a bulletin board forum for the specialty in which you are interested.
